info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Fulton, southeastern Herkimer and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dolgeville, or near Little Falls, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding on roadways. Locations impacted include... Little Falls, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Oppenheim, Ingham Mills, Crum Creek, Garlock Corners, Charlesworth Corners, Rasbach Corner, Doxtater Corner, Burrell Corners, Fink Basin, Mindenville, Davys Corners, Shedd Corners, Indian Castle, Ingham Mills Station, Newville, West Saint Johnsville and Fordsbush. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
